sshd.name: OpenSSH Server
sshd.description: Standard service for secure remote access (SSH). Provides encrypted communications over insecure networks.
sshd.risk: Medium - Open to brute-force if weak passwords are used.
sshd.recommendation: Use key-based auth, change default port, disable password login.

nginx.name: Nginx Web Server
nginx.description: High-performance HTTP server, reverse proxy, and load balancer.
nginx.risk: Low - Generally secure but misconfiguration can expose data.
nginx.recommendation: Keep updated, use HTTPS, follow hardening guides.

apache2.name: Apache HTTP Server
apache2.description: Widely used web server software. Flexible and modular.
apache2.risk: Low - Secure by default but modularity can increase attack surface.

httpd.name: Apache HTTP Server (RHEL/CentOS)
httpd.description: Red Hat variant of the Apache HTTP server. Same engine, different package name.
httpd.risk: Low - Secure by default but modularity can increase attack surface.

mysqld.name: MySQL / MariaDB Server
mysqld.risk: Medium - Risk of SQL injection in apps and brute-force if public.
mysqld.recommendation: Never expose to public internet. Bind to localhost.

mariadbd.name: MariaDB Database Server
mariadbd.description: Community-developed fork of MySQL. Drop-in replacement with additional features.
mariadbd.risk: Medium - Same attack surface as MySQL.
mariadbd.recommendation: Bind to localhost. Use strong passwords and TLS.

postgresql.name: PostgreSQL Database
postgresql.risk: Medium - Public ports are targets for brute-force.
postgresql.recommendation: Bind to localhost/VPN. Use strong pg_hba.conf auth.

redis-server.name: Redis In-Memory Data Store
redis-server.description: In-memory key-value store used as database/cache.
redis-server.risk: High - Often exposed without password by default.
redis-server.recommendation: Use strong passwords, bind to specific internal interfaces.

docker.name: Docker Daemon
docker.risk: High - Access to Docker socket/port equals root access.
docker.recommendation: Never expose the Docker API to the network without TLS.

dockerd.name: Docker Engine Daemon
dockerd.description: Background service that manages Docker containers, images, and networks.
dockerd.risk: High - Full host access through the Docker API.
dockerd.recommendation: Use TLS mutual auth. Never bind to 0.0.0.0.

containerd.name: containerd Runtime
containerd.description: Industry-standard container runtime. Used by Docker and Kubernetes.
containerd.risk: Low - Not directly network-exposed, but container escapes are possible.
containerd.recommendation: Keep updated. Use gVisor or Kata for additional isolation.

vsftpd.name: Very Secure FTP Daemon
vsftpd.description: FTP server for Linux. FTP is an older, unencrypted protocol.
vsftpd.risk: High - FTP sends passwords in cleartext. Brute-force magnet.
vsftpd.recommendation: Use SFTP (over SSH) instead. If using FTP, use FTPS.

proftpd.name: ProFTPD Server
proftpd.description: Feature-rich FTP server with modular design.
proftpd.risk: High - FTP cleartext credentials. History of vulnerabilities.
proftpd.recommendation: Migrate to SFTP. If FTP is required, enforce TLS.

pure-ftpd.name: Pure-FTPd Server
pure-ftpd.risk: High - FTP inherently insecure due to cleartext auth.
pure-ftpd.recommendation: Enforce TLS. Prefer SFTP where possible.

postfix.name: Postfix MTA
postfix.description: Mail Transfer Agent for routing and delivering e-mail.
postfix.risk: Medium - Can be used as an open relay for spam if misconfigured.

exim4.name: Exim Mail Transfer Agent
exim4.description: Highly configurable MTA used on Debian-based systems.
exim4.risk: Medium - Complex configuration can lead to open relay.

sendmail.name: Sendmail MTA
sendmail.description: One of the oldest mail transfer agents. Complex but powerful.
sendmail.risk: Medium - Long history of security vulnerabilities.
sendmail.recommendation: Consider migrating to Postfix. Keep patched.

dovecot.name: Dovecot IMAP/POP3 Server
dovecot.description: Open-source IMAP and POP3 email server.
dovecot.risk: Medium - Target for e-mail account brute-force.

smbd.name: Samba SMB Server
smbd.description: File and print services for Windows clients using SMB/CIFS protocol.
smbd.risk: High - History of RCE exploits (e.g. EternalBlue).
smbd.recommendation: Keep patched, never expose to public internet.

nmbd.name: Samba NetBIOS Name Service
nmbd.description: Provides NetBIOS name resolution for Samba. Companion to smbd.
nmbd.risk: Medium - Leaks hostname/workgroup information on the network.
nmbd.recommendation: Disable if not sharing with Windows. Firewall from WAN.

memcached.name: Memcached Store
memcached.description: In-memory caching system. No authentication by default.
memcached.risk: High - Can be abused for DDoS amplification and data theft.

cupsd.name: CUPS Printing Service
cupsd.description: Common Unix Printing System for managing printers.
cupsd.risk: Low - Can expose info about printers and system.
cupsd.recommendation: Disable if not printing. Restrict to localhost.

bind9.name: BIND DNS Server
bind9.description: Widely used Domain Name System (DNS) software.
bind9.risk: Medium - Subject to DNS amplification and cache poisoning.
bind9.recommendation: Disable open recursion if not needed.

named.name: BIND DNS Server (named)
named.description: The 'named' daemon is the BIND DNS resolver/server process.
named.risk: Medium - DNS amplification and zone transfer risks.
named.recommendation: Restrict zone transfers. Disable recursion for external queries.

mongod.name: MongoDB Database
mongod.recommendation: Enable authentication, bind to internal IP only.

mongos.name: MongoDB Shard Router
mongos.description: Routes queries to the appropriate MongoDB shard in a sharded cluster.
mongos.risk: High - Same auth concerns as mongod.
mongos.recommendation: Enable authentication, use internal network only.

ntpd.name: NTP Daemon
ntpd.description: Classic Network Time Protocol daemon for clock synchronization.
ntpd.risk: Low - Can be used for NTP amplification DDoS if misconfigured.

systemd-timesyncd.name: systemd Timesyncd
systemd-timesyncd.description: Lightweight SNTP client built into systemd for basic time synchronization.

nfsd.name: NFS Server
nfsd.description: Network File System for sharing directories over the network.
nfsd.recommendation: Only use on trusted internal networks with firewall.

snmpd.name: SNMP Agent
snmpd.description: Used for monitoring system health and performance.
snmpd.risk: Medium - Community strings (passwords) sent in cleartext (v1/v2c).
snmpd.recommendation: Use SNMPv3 with encryption or restrict to specific IPs.

rpcbind.name: RPCbind / Portmapper
rpcbind.description: Maps RPC service numbers to network ports (required for NFS).
rpcbind.recommendation: Restrict via firewall to trusted clients only.

avahi-daemon.name: Avahi mDNS/DNS-SD
avahi-daemon.description: Zero-configuration networking daemon implementing mDNS and DNS Service Discovery. Enables automatic device and service discovery on local networks (e.g. AirPrint, Chromecast). Uses port 5353 for mDNS plus dynamic high ports (e.g. 60000+) for unicast replies.
avahi-daemon.risk: Low - Broadcasts service information to the local network. No authentication.
avahi-daemon.recommendation: Disable if local discovery is not needed. Restrict with firewall if required.

rsyslogd.name: Rsyslog Service
rsyslogd.description: Standard system logging service for collecting and forwarding logs.
rsyslogd.recommendation: Use TLS for remote logging if active.

syslog-ng.name: Syslog-ng Log Daemon
syslog-ng.description: Enhanced system logging daemon with flexible filtering and routing.
syslog-ng.recommendation: Use TLS for remote log forwarding.

dnsmasq.name: Dnsmasq DNS/DHCP
dnsmasq.description: Lightweight DNS forwarder and DHCP server.
dnsmasq.risk: Low - Can be abused if listening on public interfaces.

systemd-resolved.name: systemd Resolved
systemd-resolved.description: Name resolution service for local applications. Provides a local DNS stub listener.

beam.name: Erlang VM / RabbitMQ
beam.risk: Medium - Ensure management UI is protected.
beam.recommendation: Use strong passwords for message queues.

beam.smp.name: Erlang VM (SMP)
beam.smp.description: Multi-core Erlang virtual machine. Powers RabbitMQ, CouchDB, and similar applications.
beam.smp.risk: Medium - Management interfaces can be targeted.
beam.smp.recommendation: Restrict management ports. Use SSL for AMQP.

python.name: Python Application
python.description: Custom application or script written in Python.
python.risk: Varies - Depends on the application logic.

python3.name: Python 3 Application
python3.description: Application running on Python 3 interpreter. Common for web servers (Django, Flask, FastAPI).
python3.risk: Varies - Depends on the application logic and framework.
python3.recommendation: Keep dependencies updated (pip audit). Use WSGI/ASGI server in production.

node.name: Node.js Application
node.risk: Varies - Security depends on app code and dependencies.

java.name: Java Application
java.description: Application running on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). Could be Tomcat, Spring Boot, Kafka, or custom app.
java.risk: Varies - Log4j-class vulnerabilities can be critical.
java.recommendation: Keep JVM and libraries updated. Monitor CVEs.

openvpn.name: OpenVPN Server
openvpn.description: Open-source VPN server for creating secure point-to-point or site-to-site connections.
openvpn.risk: Low - Encrypted tunnel, but server compromise exposes all VPN traffic.

wireguard.name: WireGuard VPN
wireguard.description: Modern, lightweight VPN protocol with strong cryptography and minimal attack surface.
wireguard.risk: Very Low - Modern cryptography with minimal codebase.
wireguard.recommendation: Rotate keys periodically. Restrict allowed IPs.

wg.name: WireGuard VPN Interface
wg.risk: Very Low - Runs in kernel space with modern crypto.

squid.name: Squid Proxy Server
squid.description: Caching and forwarding HTTP web proxy.
squid.risk: Medium - Can be used as an open proxy if misconfigured.
squid.recommendation: Restrict access via ACLs. Do not allow open proxying.

haproxy.name: HAProxy Load Balancer
haproxy.description: High-performance TCP/HTTP load balancer and reverse proxy.
haproxy.risk: Low - Well-audited codebase. Stats page can leak info.
haproxy.recommendation: Protect stats endpoint. Use SSL termination.

traefik.name: Traefik Reverse Proxy
traefik.description: Modern cloud-native reverse proxy and load balancer with auto-discovery.
traefik.risk: Low - Dashboard can expose configuration if unprotected.
traefik.recommendation: Protect dashboard with authentication. Use TLS.

caddy.name: Caddy Web Server
caddy.description: Modern web server with automatic HTTPS via Let's Encrypt.
caddy.risk: Very Low - Automatic HTTPS and secure defaults.
caddy.recommendation: Keep updated. Review Caddyfile for misconfigurations.

lighttpd.name: Lighttpd Web Server
lighttpd.description: Lightweight, high-performance web server optimized for speed-critical environments.
lighttpd.risk: Low - Smaller attack surface than Apache.

elasticsearch.name: Elasticsearch
elasticsearch.description: Distributed search and analytics engine. Part of the ELK stack.
elasticsearch.risk: High - No authentication by default in older versions. Data exfiltration risk.
elasticsearch.recommendation: Enable X-Pack security. Never expose to public internet.

kibana.name: Kibana Dashboard
kibana.description: Data visualization and exploration tool for Elasticsearch.
kibana.risk: Medium - Can expose sensitive log data.
kibana.recommendation: Protect with authentication. Restrict network access.

logstash.name: Logstash Pipeline
logstash.description: Server-side data processing pipeline that ingests, transforms, and sends data.
logstash.risk: Low - Input plugins can be vectors if exposed.
logstash.recommendation: Restrict input ports to trusted sources.

grafana.name: Grafana Dashboard
grafana.description: Open-source analytics and monitoring platform with rich visualization.
grafana.risk: Medium - Default admin/admin credentials. Plugin vulnerabilities.
grafana.recommendation: Change default password. Keep updated. Restrict access.

prometheus.name: Prometheus Monitoring
prometheus.description: Open-source systems monitoring and alerting toolkit.
prometheus.risk: Medium - Metrics endpoint can leak sensitive infrastructure info.

influxd.name: InfluxDB Time-Series Database
influxd.description: Purpose-built time-series database for metrics and events.
influxd.risk: Medium - API access without auth in older versions.
influxd.recommendation: Enable authentication. Bind to internal interfaces.

consul.name: HashiCorp Consul
consul.description: Service mesh and service discovery tool with KV store.
consul.risk: Medium - Can expose service topology and secrets.
consul.recommendation: Enable ACLs. Use TLS for all communication.

vault.name: HashiCorp Vault
vault.description: Secrets management and data protection platform.
vault.risk: High - Stores all secrets. Compromise is catastrophic.
vault.recommendation: Use auto-unseal. Enable audit logging. Restrict access.

etcd.name: etcd Key-Value Store
etcd.description: Distributed key-value store used by Kubernetes for cluster state.
etcd.risk: Critical - Contains all Kubernetes secrets and config.
etcd.recommendation: Enable TLS mutual auth. Restrict to cluster nodes only.

kubelet.name: Kubernetes Kubelet
kubelet.description: Primary node agent that manages pods and containers on each Kubernetes node.
kubelet.risk: High - Unauthenticated API can allow container exec.

kube-apiserver.name: Kubernetes API Server
kube-apiserver.description: Central management component of a Kubernetes cluster.
kube-apiserver.recommendation: Use RBAC. Enable audit logging. Restrict network access.

kube-proxy.name: Kubernetes Proxy
kube-proxy.description: Network proxy that maintains network rules for pod communication.

coredns.name: CoreDNS
coredns.description: Flexible, plugin-based DNS server. Default DNS in Kubernetes clusters.

cockpit-ws.name: Cockpit Web Console
cockpit-ws.description: Web-based server management interface for Linux.
cockpit-ws.risk: Medium - Full system management via web UI.
cockpit-ws.recommendation: Restrict to trusted networks. Use strong passwords.

cockpit-tls.name: Cockpit TLS Proxy
cockpit-tls.description: TLS termination proxy for Cockpit web console.
cockpit-tls.risk: Medium - Gateway to full system management.

zabbix_server.name: Zabbix Monitoring Server
zabbix_server.risk: Medium - Can execute remote commands on agents.
zabbix_server.recommendation: Use TLS for agent communication. Restrict access.

zabbix_agentd.name: Zabbix Monitoring Agent
zabbix_agentd.description: Agent that collects system metrics and sends them to Zabbix server.
zabbix_agentd.recommendation: Restrict connections to Zabbix server IP only.

gitea.name: Gitea Git Service
gitea.description: Lightweight, self-hosted Git service. Community fork of Gogs.
gitea.risk: Medium - Contains source code. Can be targeted.

gitlab-workhorse.name: GitLab Workhorse
gitlab-workhorse.description: Reverse proxy for GitLab that handles large file uploads and Git operations.
gitlab-workhorse.recommendation: Keep GitLab updated as a whole.

jenkins.name: Jenkins CI/CD Server
jenkins.description: Automation server for continuous integration and delivery.
jenkins.risk: High - Script console allows arbitrary code execution.
jenkins.recommendation: Restrict access. Disable script console. Use HTTPS.

samba.name: Samba File Server (Generic)
samba.description: File/print services using SMB/CIFS protocol for cross-platform sharing.
samba.risk: High - Wide attack surface. History of critical CVEs.
samba.recommendation: Keep patched. Restrict to internal network.

sshfs.name: SSHFS Mount
sshfs.description: Filesystem client based on SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP).

xinetd.name: xinetd Super Server
xinetd.description: Extended Internet services daemon. Manages multiple network services on demand.
xinetd.risk: Medium - Manages legacy services that may be insecure.
xinetd.recommendation: Replace with systemd socket activation. Disable unused services.

dhcpd.name: ISC DHCP Server
dhcpd.description: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol server for assigning IP addresses.
dhcpd.risk: Medium - Rogue DHCP can redirect traffic.
dhcpd.recommendation: Restrict to trusted interface. Enable DHCP snooping on switches.

dhclient.name: ISC DHCP Client
dhclient.description: DHCP client daemon that requests IP configuration from a DHCP server.

tftpd.name: TFTP Server
tftpd.description: Trivial File Transfer Protocol server. No authentication or encryption.
tftpd.risk: High - No authentication whatsoever. Anyone can read/write files.
tftpd.recommendation: Restrict to internal PXE boot network only.

in.tftpd.name: TFTP Server (inetd)
in.tftpd.description: TFTP server launched via inetd/xinetd. Used for PXE boot and firmware updates.
in.tftpd.recommendation: Isolate on dedicated VLAN for provisioning.

ntp.name: NTP Service
ntp.description: Network Time Protocol for clock synchronization across systems.
ntp.risk: Low - Can be used for amplification attacks.

syslogd.name: System Log Daemon
syslogd.recommendation: Use rsyslog or syslog-ng for better features.

cron.name: Cron Scheduler
cron.description: Time-based job scheduler daemon. Executes commands at scheduled intervals.
cron.risk: Low - Can be abused if crontab is writable by attacker.

atd.name: At Scheduler Daemon
atd.description: Runs commands scheduled for one-time execution via the 'at' command.

agetty.name: Alternative Getty
agetty.description: Terminal login prompt manager. Opens login sessions on virtual consoles.
agetty.risk: Very Low - Local console access only.

polkitd.name: PolicyKit Daemon
polkitd.description: Authorization framework for controlling system-wide privileges.
polkitd.risk: Low - Local privilege escalation vectors exist (CVE-2021-4034).
polkitd.recommendation: Keep updated. Monitor for privilege escalation CVEs.

NetworkManager.name: NetworkManager
NetworkManager.description: Dynamic network control and configuration daemon.

wpa_supplicant.name: WPA Supplicant
wpa_supplicant.description: Wi-Fi Protected Access client for wireless network authentication.

bluetoothd.name: Bluetooth Daemon
bluetoothd.risk: Low - Bluetooth can be a local attack vector (BlueBorne).
bluetoothd.recommendation: Disable if not needed. Keep kernel updated.

pulseaudio.name: PulseAudio Sound Server
pulseaudio.description: Network-capable sound server for Linux desktop environments.
pulseaudio.recommendation: Disable network module if not streaming.

pipewire.name: PipeWire Multimedia Server
pipewire.description: Modern multimedia processing framework replacing PulseAudio and JACK.

Xorg.name: X.Org Display Server
Xorg.description: Legacy display server for Linux graphical environments.
Xorg.risk: Medium - X11 forwarding can be intercepted. Keylogging possible.
Xorg.recommendation: Disable TCP listening. Use Wayland if possible.

samba-ad-dc.name: Samba Active Directory DC
samba-ad-dc.description: Samba acting as an Active Directory Domain Controller.
samba-ad-dc.risk: High - Domain controller compromise gives full network access.
samba-ad-dc.recommendation: Harden like a real AD DC. Keep patched.

mariadb.name: MariaDB Database
mariadb.description: Community-developed fork of MySQL. Fully compatible replacement.
mariadb.risk: Medium - Same attack surface as MySQL.
mariadb.recommendation: Bind to localhost. Use strong passwords.

cockroach.name: CockroachDB
cockroach.description: Distributed SQL database designed for cloud-native applications.
cockroach.risk: Medium - Distributed systems require careful network security.
cockroach.recommendation: Enable TLS. Restrict inter-node and client ports.

cassandra.name: Apache Cassandra
cassandra.description: Distributed NoSQL database for handling large amounts of data across nodes.
cassandra.risk: Medium - No auth by default in older versions.

couchdb.name: Apache CouchDB
couchdb.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database with HTTP API.
couchdb.risk: High - Admin party mode (no auth) in default installs.
couchdb.recommendation: Set admin password immediately. Bind to localhost.

clickhouse-server.name: ClickHouse Analytics DB
clickhouse-server.description: Column-oriented database management system for online analytical processing (OLAP).

kafka.name: Apache Kafka
kafka.description: Distributed event streaming platform for high-throughput data pipelines.
kafka.risk: Medium - No auth by default. Can leak sensitive data streams.

mosquitto.name: Eclipse Mosquitto MQTT
mosquitto.description: Lightweight message broker implementing MQTT protocol for IoT.
mosquitto.risk: Medium - No auth by default. IoT data exposure.

nats-server.name: NATS Message Server
nats-server.description: Cloud-native messaging system for microservices and IoT.

minio.name: MinIO Object Storage
minio.recommendation: Change default credentials immediately. Use TLS.

stunnel.name: Stunnel TLS Wrapper
stunnel.description: Universal TLS/SSL tunneling service for wrapping insecure protocols.
stunnel.risk: Low - Adds encryption to plaintext services.

fail2ban-server.name: Fail2Ban Intrusion Prevention
fail2ban-server.description: Scans log files and bans IPs showing malicious signs (brute-force, etc.).
fail2ban-server.recommendation: Keep rules updated. Monitor ban logs.

clamd.name: ClamAV Antivirus Daemon
clamd.description: Open-source antivirus engine for detecting malware, viruses, and trojans.

freshclam.name: ClamAV Update Daemon
freshclam.description: Automatic virus database updater for ClamAV.

unbound.name: Unbound DNS Resolver
unbound.description: Validating, recursive, and caching DNS resolver with DNSSEC support.
unbound.recommendation: Enable DNSSEC validation. Restrict to localhost.

pihole-FTL.name: Pi-hole FTL DNS
pihole-FTL.description: Pi-hole's DNS/DHCP server for network-wide ad blocking.

tor.name: Tor Anonymity Network
tor.description: Onion routing network for anonymous communication.
tor.risk: Medium - Exit node can be used for malicious traffic.
tor.recommendation: Monitor if running as exit node. Use for SOCKS proxy only.

privoxy.name: Privoxy Privacy Proxy
privoxy.description: Non-caching web proxy with advanced filtering capabilities for privacy.

i2pd.name: I2P Router Daemon
i2pd.description: C++ implementation of the I2P anonymous network.

syncthing.name: Syncthing File Sync
syncthing.description: Continuous file synchronization program. Peer-to-peer, no cloud needed.
syncthing.recommendation: Use device authentication. Restrict GUI access.

rsyncd.name: Rsync Daemon
rsyncd.risk: Medium - Can expose filesystem if misconfigured.
rsyncd.recommendation: Use SSH-based rsync instead. Require authentication.

nrpe.name: Nagios NRPE Agent
nrpe.description: Nagios Remote Plugin Executor for running monitoring checks.
nrpe.recommendation: Restrict to Nagios server IP. Use SSL.

node_exporter.name: Prometheus Node Exporter
node_exporter.description: Exports hardware and OS metrics for Prometheus monitoring.
node_exporter.recommendation: Restrict access to Prometheus server only.

blackbox_exporter.name: Prometheus Blackbox Exporter
blackbox_exporter.description: Probes endpoints over HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, TCP, and ICMP for Prometheus.

alertmanager.name: Prometheus Alertmanager
alertmanager.description: Handles alerts sent by Prometheus and routes them to receivers.

ntopng.name: ntopng Network Monitor
ntopng.description: High-speed web-based traffic analysis and flow collection tool.
ntopng.risk: Medium - Exposes detailed network traffic data.

lxd.name: LXD Container Manager
lxd.description: System container and virtual machine manager built on LXC.
lxd.risk: High - Container management with potential host escape.
lxd.recommendation: Use TLS certificates. Restrict API access.

libvirtd.name: Libvirt Virtualization Daemon
libvirtd.description: Manages virtual machines (KVM, QEMU, Xen) and virtual networks.
libvirtd.recommendation: Use TLS. Restrict to trusted management hosts.

qemu-system.name: QEMU Virtual Machine
qemu-system.description: Hardware virtualization emulator. Backend for KVM virtual machines.

VBoxHeadless.name: VirtualBox Headless VM
VBoxHeadless.description: Oracle VirtualBox running a VM without a GUI.

udisksd.name: UDisks Disk Manager
udisksd.description: D-Bus service for handling storage devices (mount, unmount, format).

thermald.name: Intel Thermal Daemon
thermald.description: Monitors and controls system temperatures to prevent overheating.

irqbalance.name: IRQ Balance Daemon
irqbalance.description: Distributes hardware interrupts across CPUs for optimal performance.

accounts-daemon.name: Accounts Service
accounts-daemon.description: D-Bus service for querying and manipulating user account information.

gdm.name: GNOME Display Manager
gdm.description: Login screen manager for GNOME desktop environment.

sddm.name: SDDM Display Manager
sddm.description: Modern display manager for KDE Plasma and LXQt desktops.

dbus-daemon.name: D-Bus Message Bus
dbus-daemon.description: System-wide message bus for inter-process communication (IPC). Essential for desktop environments.

systemd-journald.name: Systemd Journal Service
systemd-journald.description: Collects and stores logging data from the kernel, services, and applications.

ModemManager.name: Modem Manager
ModemManager.description: Controls mobile broadband (2G/3G/4G/5G) devices and connections.
ModemManager.recommendation: Disable if no mobile modem is used.

colord.name: Color Management Daemon
colord.description: Manages color profiles for printers, scanners, and monitors.

rtkit-daemon.name: Realtime Kit
rtkit-daemon.description: D-Bus system service that hands out realtime scheduling priority to user processes.

packagekitd.name: PackageKit Daemon
packagekitd.description: D-Bus abstraction layer for software management (installing, updating, removing packages).
packagekitd.recommendation: Keep system updated. PackageKit is used by GUI software centers.

upowerd.name: Power Management Daemon
upowerd.description: Handles power management, battery levels, and energy sources.

winbindd.name: Samba Winbind
winbindd.description: Resolves user and group information from Windows NT/Active Directory servers.

qemu-system-x86_64.name: QEMU x86_64 Emulator
qemu-system-x86_64.description: Full hardware emulation for x86_64 virtual machines.

containerd-shim.name: Containerd Shim
containerd-shim.description: Manages the lifecycle of a single container (start, stop, IO).

runc.name: runc Container Runtime
runc.description: CLI tool for spawning and running containers according to OCI specification.
runc.recommendation: Keep updated to avoid container escape vulnerabilities.
